external_references.context: SEBI, vide Circular no. SEBI/HO/IMD/IMD-II CIS/P/CIR/2021/0685 dated December 13, 2021 (hereinafter mentioned as ‘Circular’) and Clause 5 of Master Circular for Research Analyst dated May 21, 2024 (hereinafter mentioned as ‘Master Circular’), inter alia, issued Investor charter for Research Analysts.
external_references.reasoning: Clearly identifies a SEBI circular with a specific number and date.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.exact_text: SEBI, Circular No. SEBI/HO/IMD/IMD-II CIS/P/CIR/2021/0685 dated December 13, 2021
external_references.context: With    the    issuance    of    this    circular,    SEBI,    Circular    No.    SEBI/HO/IMD/IMD-II CIS/P/CIR/2021/0685 dated December 13, 2021 stands rescinded and Clause 5 of Master Circular for Research Analysts dated May 21, 2024 stands amended as per this circular.
external_references.reasoning: Explicit mention of SEBI circular number and date.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.exact_text: Clause 5 of Master Circular for Research Analysts dated May 21, 2024
external_references.title: Master Circular for Research Analysts
external_references.context: With    the    issuance    of    this    circular,    SEBI,    Circular    No.    SEBI/HO/IMD/IMD-II CIS/P/CIR/2021/0685 dated December 13, 2021 stands rescinded and Clause 5 of Master Circular for Research Analysts dated May 21, 2024 stands amended as per this circular.
external_references.reasoning: Refers to a specific clause within a SEBI master circular with a date.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.exact_text: Section 11(1) of Chapter IV of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
external_references.title: Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
external_references.context: This circular is issued in exercise of powers conferred under Section 11(1) of Chapter IV of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 read with Regulation 24(9) of the SEBI  (Research  Analysts)  Regulations,  2014 to  protect  the  interests  of  investors  in securities and to promote the development of, and to regulate the securities markets and shall come into effect from the date of this circular.
external_references.reasoning: Direct reference to a specific section and chapter of the SEBI Act.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.exact_text: Regulation 24(9) of the SEBI (Research Analysts) Regulations, 2014
external_references.title: SEBI (Research Analysts) Regulations, 2014
external_references.context: This circular is issued in exercise of powers conferred under Section 11(1) of Chapter IV of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 read with Regulation 24(9) of the SEBI  (Research  Analysts)  Regulations,  2014 to  protect  the  interests  of  investors  in securities and to promote the development of, and to regulate the securities markets and shall come into effect from the date of this circular.
external_references.reasoning: Direct reference to a specific regulation with its title and year.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.exact_text: the provisions of the Advertisement Code for Research Analysts
external_references.title: Advertisement Code for Research Analysts
external_references.context: To  ensure  that  all  advertisements  are  in  adherence  to  the  provisions  of  the Advertisement Code for Research Analysts.
external_references.reasoning: Refers to an advertisement code, likely issued by SEBI, although the exact circular number is not specified.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.title: SCORES 2.0
external_references.context: In  a  move  to  enhance  financial  consumer  protection  alongside  enhanced  financial inclusion and  financial  literacy  and  in  view  of  the  recent  developments  in  the  securities market including introduction of Online Dispute Resolution (ODR) platform and SCORES 2.0, it has been decided to modify the investor charter for Research Analysts.
external_references.reasoning: Mentions SCORES 2.0, a SEBI grievance redressal system.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.title: SCORES 2.0
external_references.context: i. SCORES 2.0 (a web based centralized grievance redressal system of SEBI for facilitating effective grievance redressal in time-bound manner) (https://scores.sebi.gov.in)
external_references.reasoning: Provides a direct link to the SCORES 2.0 platform.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.title: SMARTODR platform
external_references.context: If  the  Investor  is  not  satisfied  with  the  resolution  provided  by  the  Market Participants,  then the  Investor  has  the  option  to file  the  complaint/ grievance  on SMARTODR platform for its resolution through online conciliation or arbitration.
external_references.reasoning: Refers to the SEBI's online dispute resolution platform.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.title: List of SEBI Registered Research Analysts
external_references.context: Please  refer  to  the  list  of  all  SEBI  registered Research Analyst which  is available on SEBI website in the following link: https://www.sebi.gov.in/sebiweb/other/OtherAction.do?doRecognisedFpi=yes&intmId=14
external_references.reasoning: Provides a direct link to a list of registered research analysts on the SEBI website.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.exact_text: Centralized Fee Collection Mechanism (CeFCoM) of RAASB
external_references.title: Centralized Fee Collection Mechanism (CeFCoM)
external_references.context: You  may  make payment of fees through Centralized Fee Collection Mechanism (CeFCoM) of RAASB if research analyst has opted for the mechanism. (Applicable for fee paying clients only)
external_references.reasoning: Refers to a specific fee collection mechanism, likely managed by RAASB.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection

external_references.context: Further,  RA  must  close such impersonation related complaints after following the due process as specified by SEBI/ RAASB.
external_references.reasoning: Mentions SEBI and RAASB in the context of due process for complaints.
external_references.note: Referenced document not in local collection
